context: "Lõunasse" is an Estonian directional adverb meaning "southward" or "to the south." It indicates movement toward the southern direction. The word is formed from "lõuna" (south) with the illative case ending "-sse" which indicates motion into or toward a place. This construction follows the pattern of many Estonian directional words where the basic word for a cardinal direction is combined with the illative suffix to indicate movement in that direction.
